title: Why vintage-style bombé rings are making a glamorous statement once again
text:
Domed, fat, bulging... No wonder the French word bombé is preferred to describe a certain style of jewel. Applied to any ring with a rounded shape that tapers at the sides, bombé sounds infinitely more elegant than any of its English translations, none of which quite do for this statement-making, 1940s original.

Suzanne Belperron, the great early-to-mid-20th century Parisian jeweller whose daringly avant-garde designs have never truly been matched, was instrumental in bringing a particularly smooth, organic look to the bombé shape, often carved from quartz or chalcedony and topped with a faceted stone.

Today's clutch of boldly rounded beauties form their shape through the full array of means....
